sentence.text: After I had been kept waiting for a few moments in an ante-room , I was ushered into the main boardroom where Dr Barton and six colleagues were seated around a long , rectangular , polished table .
The most obvious sign of the Diana 's new life was the sight of her Scotland Yard bodyguard who was seated at a nearby table .
The company was seated round card tables in the drawing-room , with the exception of Miss Phoebe in her usual chair and the Captain who was warming his backside at the great fire , glass in hand .
Lawrence was now seated at the kitchen table concentrating hard on a bowl of cornflakes , while running a finger down the Foreign Exchange rates in the Financial Times .
The king was seated at the main table with his drinking friends .
So she hurried downstairs to fix herself some breakfast -- and almost stopped in her tracks at the sight of the figure who was seated at the kitchen table .
There were seven people seated at the long table .
But Uncle Philip was not seated at the table , scowling at the two empty places ; his place was not even set ready .
Aubrey remained seated in the armchair by the window , his eyes thoughtful .
When they went into the big bedroom , Patrick was seated in an armchair facing the door , dressed in his blue serge suit waiting for Rosie .
Ah , Gregory -- " She received him grandly , seated in an armchair specially moved into the bedroom .
Franz was seated in an armchair with a glass in his hand .
The first three rows , seated in rather tatty red plush armchairs , were occupied by Gamal 's friends and supporters and were respectable , at least in terms of numbers .
Scouse was seated in his armchair reading a paperback -- a Western -- oblivious to the flies and mosquitoes , and as I approached it was obvious he was not bothered in any way about the smell .
It was only then that I noticed the small man seated in the armchair next to mine .
McQuaid was seated in the armchair by the fire .
The General was seated at his desk .
There was a man seated behind the desk reading a book .
He was seated at his desk , his back to the window , so she could not see his expression clearly .
A man who was seated behind a desk on the far side of the bars jumped up the moment he saw the chairman and turned the lock on the steel door with a long-shafted key .
Reception consists of a uniformed man seated behind a shabby desk .
He hobbled through the first available door , which was marked Adjutant General , and saw a red-faced major seated behind the desk .
` Over there , " said Heidi , pointing to a woman who was seated behind a desk .
A weird island , they found as they walked the last half mile -- after leaving the Mercedes in a car park with Dillon seated in the rear .
Directions were given by the experimenter who was seated in the rear of the vehicle .
She was seated in her chair like a cold stone statue , her face turned upward and away as an indication of her contempt .
James Price , Tom , Dolly and Carrie were seated around the room .
Mr Bush , the young headmaster of the village school , was seated behind the pulpit at the organ .
Dr Neil was now seated at his desk and she lingered a little .
There was even a fireplace set in the wall and , seated at the head of a long polished table , was the Lord Bruce .
He was seated at an easel .
Legion was seated at the head of the table , and to either side of her , and floated up near the ceiling .
Mr and Mrs Bloggs are expected to sit thumbing through the books whilst the teacher , seated at the front of the classroom , rapidly lectures another anxious parent .
Peggy Mitchell , seated at the rear of the Variety Tent , sighed in sympathy as , one after another , the right card failed to appear from or disappear into the deck .
The dead person was then taken by Horus and presented to Osiris , who was seated on his throne accompanied by Isis and Nephthys , and received his reward to admittance to the afterlife .
He opened his eyes to find himself in a dimly-lit tent , seated upon hard muddy grass .
The Leader and the thin man were seated on a pile of saddles and saddle-bags with their backs against the wall .
Then he turned to the Minister of State for Defence , seated on his left , and said , ` Richard , will you repeat the information you gave me earlier ? "
On 8 May , about 8 o'clock in the morning , I was seated on the doorstep of my house .
Karelius remained seated on his mare , wrapped in his thoughts .
A despairing mother , spotting a thirteen-year-old boy seated by an open window , thrust her infant into his arms .
The rest of the children were seated on the ground so that all five of them were now very exposed .
Captain Lionel Dunbar looked reproachfully at the young man seated opposite him .
He found Carrie seated by the bedside , but was distressed to find that Anna would not talk to him .
Cheryl Russell was seated on the far side of the refectory , watching the simularity .
We were by now seated in the Happy Diner , and I was still rather amazed that I could face a bacon sandwich .
Chamlong , seated beside Suchinda , appealed to protestors to refrain from violence .
They were seated round the long oak table , with the remains of supper still spread out .
Following our father 's advice both brothers made sure I was seated between them , at the same time refusing to exchange a word with me .
Once she was seated , he put his arms around her , cradling her fair head against his chest .
